articles.title: Israel launches strikes on ‘dozens’ of targets in Iran, targeting nuclear program
articles.description: Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, says attack dubbed Rising Lion would take ‘many days’
articles.content:
Israel has launched an attack on Iran aimed at “dozens” of targets including its nuclear facilities, claiming that Tehran had begun to build nuclear warheads.

articles.title: How long is a vagina? And how do I know if mine is ‘short’?
articles.description: The length of your vagina can change with age, hormones and sexual arousal.
articles.content:
We often use the word vagina to describe everything “down there”, but that’s not actually anatomically correct.
The vagina is the stretchy, muscular tube that connects the external genitalia, or vulva, to the cervix, which is the entrance to the uter... [5154 chars]

articles.title: Duterte appeals to ICC for interim release to undisclosed country
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines — Former president Rodrigo Duterte requested an interim release from the International Criminal Court (ICC) to an undisclosed country, according to a recent filing by his legal counsel.
articles.content:

articles.title: Israel launches strikes on Iran amid rising tensions over nuclear enrichment
articles.description: Israel carries out strikes on Iran, after days of escalating tensions over the nation's efforts to develop nuclear technology.
articles.content:
Israel has carried out strikes on Iran, killing Revolutionary Guard Commander Hossein Salami, according to Iranian state media reports.
It comes after days of escalating tensions over the nation's efforts to develop nuclear technology.

articles.title: Inquiry into Orroral Valley bushfire finds Defence helicopter crew made 'error of judgement' after accidentally sparking blaze
articles.description: An inquiry into the devastating Orroral Valley fire near Canberra in 2020 has found the crew of a Defence helicopter who accidentally started the blaze made an "error of judgement" in not notifying authorities of the fire.
articles.content:

articles.title: Meta is paying $14 billion to catch up in the AI race
articles.description: Meta is paying $14.3 billion to invest in Scale AI, the industry’s leading data dealer, and hire its CEO, Alexandr Wang to work on AI “superintelligence.”
articles.content:
Meta is paying $14.3 billion to acquire 49 percent of Scale AI and hire its CEO, Alexandr Wang, to revamp its troubled AI efforts.
As part of the deal, Wang will report directly to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and remain on Scale’s board of directors, bo... [3863 chars]
